required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparisons of Complications Related to Two Approaches of Ultrasonography-guided Subclavian Venous Catheterization
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Non-inferiority Trial on Complications Related to Ultrasonography-guided Subclavian Venous Catheterization: Supraclavicular Versus Infraclavicular Approach

brief_summary.textblock: For performing subclavian venous catheterization, two approaches (supraclavicular and infraclavicular) have been used successfully in various clinical practice. However, there remains controversy concerning which approach is safer and causes less complications during ultrasonography-guided subclavian venous catheterization. In this context, the investigators sought to compare supraclavicular approach with infraclavicular approach in terms of post-procedural complications during ultrasonography-guided subclavian venous catheterization.

primary_outcome.time_frame: intraoperatively to 1 hour after the admission of ICU
primary_outcome.description: The overall incidence of complications will be expressed as the sum of incidences of complications which occurred during subclavian venous catheterization including arterial puncture, hematoma formation, pneumothorax, hemothorax, and malposition of catheter. Arterial puncture, hematoma formation, and malposition of catheter will be evaluated with ultrasonography, and pneumothorax and hemothorax will be evaluated by chest radiography.

secondary_outcome.description: The first-pass success was defined as successful catheterization on a single attempt in all stages of catheterization.

secondary_outcome.measure: the number of needling for venipuncture
secondary_outcome.description: The number of needling for venipuncture was defined as the amount of needling for successful subclavian venous puncture.
Total time for venipuncture was defined as the amount of time which took for successful subclavian venous puncture.

arm_group.description: In the infraclavicular group, subclavian venous catheterization using ultrasonography is performed beneath the clavicle.
In the supraclavicular group, subclavian venous catheterization using ultrasonography is performed over the clavicle.

intervention.intervention_name: Supra- vs Infraclavicular approach using ultrasonography
intervention.description: In the supraclavicular group, subclavian venous catheterization using ultrasonography is performed beneath the clavicle. Meanwhile, in the infraclavicular group, subclavian venous catheterization using ultrasonography is performed over the clavicle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who require subclavian venous catheterization
- adult patients aged 20-79
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient's refusal
- patients with contraindication of subclavian venous catheterization (skin infection at puncture site, tumor or thrombus in the course of subclavian vein, vegetation at tricuspid valve, patients on anticoagulation)
- patients with chemoport or pacemaker in subclavian vein
- patients with right-sided breast cancer operation or with right-sided pneumonectomy
